result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David James Roberts Jr

records.addlTxt: COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant David James Roberts not in court.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Calendar Call. Attorney Al-Henaey not present in court for the purpose of today's hearing. Court WAIVED defense counsels appearance. Defendant failing to appear, Court lifted the previous stay on warrant and ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE. Court further takes no action as to bail.

Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey in court.  Patrick T. Franken appeared on behalf of Amy Spanczak for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Calendar Call. Defendant failing to appear. Defense counsel requests case be adjourned for an additional Calendar Call, due to recent contact with client. Objections from the State. Court grants defense's request and adjourns matter to Br 16.  Calendar call scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey in court.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Case adjourned for a Calendar Call to Br 16.  Calendar call scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David James Roberts in court, appear in person with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey, appear in person.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant David James Roberts in court with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Defendant David James Roberts in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  David James Roberts appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
